TopicTitle: I...I think I broke the game...?

Articles.Content:
Recently I\'ve been mucking about in deep space. Solar Orbits and Interstellar missions, you know how it is.

So I put my self on an Solar Escape Trajectory (In 13 minutes ) and saw immediately that the physics were beginning to break down.

I just found it quite interesting and amusing to see how the game behaves in such a situation.

Here are some pictures -

http://imgur.com/a/6iV2h

Crazy stuff, man.

Well, as long as you don\'t get something like this:

then I don\'t call it broken

But I must say I never saw an orbit curving like that...

But I must say I never saw an orbit curving like that...

Altho, how did the sun... MOVE?

Well, as long as you don\'t get something like this:

then I don\'t call it broken

But I must say I never saw an orbit curving like that...

Acually, I did get something similar to this. Not a butterfly like you got, but an orbit that had a solar escape, and had some very odd kinks in the orbit.

Curiously, it was a weird bug how I got into it in the first place. I put myself in a solar orbit, just below kerbin speed. I then went out to tracking station and back in, at which point there was a random strut sticking out. When I tried to turn my ship it went into an insane spin, the game stuttered for a moment, and then popped me into an orbit going the opposite direction at 18,000m/s.

Altho, how did the sun... MOVE?

With giant sun-legs, of course! It simply got up, walked somewhere else, and sat back down!

Well, as long as you don\'t get something like this:

then I don\'t call it broken

But I must say I never saw an orbit curving like that...

Yes! I did get something similar to that! When I targeted anything back in the Kerbol system, all the orbits/trajectories were jagged and some of the bodies were out of place! I don\'t have time to upload a screenshot right now, but it was there before mine very eyes.

Yeah. Not even the Kraken could explain that. Though, IRL cosmology makes just about as much sense. From what I heard, satellites on certain orbits can speed up, slow down, and even change course slightly without any propulsive force.
